author: Merlynne Rae Backstrom
title: Competition to purchase health insurance across state lines will NOT bring down the cost of health insurance! Why is that? BECAUSE this is not a type of insurance that one buys and hopes to never need to use it!Health insurance coverage is purchased by folks who know in advance they will need to use it and so do those insurance companies who sell the health insurance! And because we have an archaic health insurance system in place which does not "work," no group purchase big or small local or national, will bring costs down!How do we then need to approach health coverage? We need a whole new approach which is akin to Social Security and Medicare. Why is that? Because unless absolutely everyone "buys in" then the old broken system of cheap for the young and healthy, verses expensive for the poor elderly and ill, will continue down the same wrong road and fall into the bottomless moneypit that awaits!How do other nations who provide health insurance for ALL of their citizens approach national health coverage? It isn\'t about "competition" and a false promise of lower premiums and the lie of more covereage!What do I mean? We are not going to FIX what\'s wrong by attempting to apply an arrangement that\'s doomed before it hits the Senate floor for a vote!!! There are times when a government MUST take up the cause for all of it\'s citizens ~ national health coverage is imperative for our nation IF we are truly serious that every single American citizen have fair affordable health coverage!!!National Health Coverage. Why can\'t everyone fill out just one more form when employeed that has one check for "self" or for "family" and have a national health insurance withheld from wages? Have it all go into one fund and out of that insure everyone. Everyone gets a medical ID card. Everyone gets health insurance covereage with the emphasis on preventative well-care. Everyone gets a yearly physical and whatever tests are needed appropriate to age and gender. Everyone pays and everyone is covered.Why does this need to be hundreds or thousands of pages or hours of debate? Just one form that everyone fills out. No exemptions. No opting out. No excuses. Those who are unable to work can file for special coverage. Why does it have to be so complicated? Why does it have to depend on where one lives, what the popuation, etc. And why can\'t our country decide once and for all that everyone deserves to have health insurance and medical care whether they are rich or poor?Well, I\'m guessing if we took all the current budgeted monies that go for this health progam and that health program, and all the monies individual citizens pay in already, it would be fully funded to have a national health insurance plan. And if it was a matter of more budgetary funding needed, then everyone\'s amount would be adjusted. If everyone paid the same X percent of wages earned, no one would pay more than they could afford. No one rich would pay a less percentage than a poor person. And a poor person would not get a freebie, but pay a X percent of their wages.Can\'t we come up with a fair simple workable idea that benefits every American fairly without unjustly making the most vulnerable pay the most and those who are rich pay the least? Why should we have insurance companies making a profit off of each of our health needs? Is that necessary?By the way, everyone who drives must have vehicle insurance. Everyone who borrows on a home has mortgage insurance. We take out flood and fire insurance, renters insurance, life insurance. We all fill out a W-2 for withholding purposes for employment wages earned. Why can\'t we each fill out a form for withholding purposes for X% to be withheld from wages earned? We pay taxes for roads, schools, purchases, and earnings. Why can\'t we each pay X% for national health insurance? There are brilliant minds who know how to set this up fairly so that no one is left out and no one pays more than their share, and no one who can pay gets to opt out.As a nation, we have plenty to go around...why don\'t we take care of each other and just agree to have National Health Coverage? We know what it costs to provide care. There are super computers to project what it would cost. Can\'t we do this for ourselves as a nation? If we can register to vote when we get a driver\'s license, why can\'t we register for National Health Coverage when we get a job?

author: Shauna Ivy-Lynn Smallwood
title: Hello Ellen! I\'m not sure if you\'ll see this or not, but I wanted to thank you. For 10 years of my life, my mother was very very sick and depression came along with that. But whenever she would watch your show, I saw her eyes light up. The things you do for people are the things she would\'ve done if she had the means. I have two LGBT siblings, and my mother accepted them and loved them even when the world turned their back on them. A lot of the time, when she would watch your show, she would mention how much love you had. She would mention the things you did for people, and the money you gave people. And then she would tell me how little money meant to her and how you had all the right ideas.My mother passed away on Monday, March 6th. And the funeral is tomorrow. My family is in need. She has 7 children that are spread out across the East Coast. We need traveling money to get her buried in Indiana, as we live in West Virginia. I am only 19 years old, and I have been planning the funeral. We have a Gofundme set up for the costs, and I\'m not asking you to give, but if you could get the word out, I would be so thankful, for the rest of my life.Thank you again, Ellen, for always bringing smiles into a home of hurt and sickness.

author: Shauna Ivy-Lynn Smallwood
title: Hello Ellen! I\'m not sure if you\'ll see this or not, but I wanted to thank you. For 10 years of my life, my mother was very very sick and depression came along with that. But whenever she would watch your show, I saw her eyes light up. The things you do for people are the things she would\'ve done if she had the means. I have two LGBT siblings, and my mother accepted them and loved them even when the world turned their back on them. A lot of the time, when she would watch your show, she would mention how much love you had. She would mention the things you did for people, and the money you gave people. And then she would tell me how little money meant to her and how you had all the right ideas.My mother passed away on Monday, March 6th. And the funeral is tomorrow. My family is in need. She has 7 children that are spread out across the East Coast. We need traveling money to get her buried in Indiana, as we live in West Virginia. I am only 19 years old, and I have been planning the funeral. We have a Gofundme set up for the costs, and I\'m not asking you to give, but if you could get the word out, I would be so thankful, for the rest of my life.Thank you again, Ellen, for always bringing smiles into a home of hurt and sickness.

author: Stacy Johnson Shook
title: PLEASE, please consider donating to this cause. This precious family is trying to raise funds to insure their daughter Sadie Rae gets the trial treatment she needs for a rare disease. Little Sadie turns 1 tomorrow and they have set a goal to raise $10,000 the week before her bday. They are sooooo close to reaching this goal. Please donate if you are able. I have pasted the link to their story, along with the post written by Sadie\'s mother, Ashley Smith Haywood. Thank you all so much!! So tomorrow is our baby’s 1st Birthday.   What a rollercoaster year it has been, and we know we are just getting started.   We know the future is uncertain…for all of us really, so we take it day by day.  Sadie knows nothing but love by all that surround her and tomorrow will be no different in that respect.  There will be balloons, presents, streamers, cake and smiles with family and friends, as it should be.  Despite it all, we are going to celebrate tomorrow, for what it is… a very special birthday for the little girl we love more than life itself.   Your thoughts, prayers, comments, and support through this birthday campaign have once again shown us that we are not alone in this fight.Sadie’s birthday campaign has already raised over $7,000 toward the $10,000 goal.  To be honest, when we started this birthday gift of life campaign, it seemed like raising $10,000 in just 5 days was a long shot.  Now though, it feels within reach and that is thanks to each and every one of you!  Thank you for helping make tomorrow a #viral birthday for Sadie!  When Sadie gets older, we look forward to telling her how everyone came together in honor of her first birthday.Come back tomorrow to see photos of our sweet girl on her big day!  If you feel compelled, please DONATE and SHARE to help fund research that could extend Sadie\'s story for years to come. If just 50 more people donate $50, we will reach our goal! Please click here to contribute to Sadie\'s birthday campaign: www.SadieTurns1.com#SadieTurns1
